mechanoreception.notes: As echinoderms, Faujasiidae likely possess mechanoreceptors for sensing touch and pressure in their environment. This is inferred as a general feature of echinoderms.

chemoreception.notes: Like other echinoderms, Faujasiidae likely use chemoreception to detect chemical cues in the water for foraging and other behaviors. This is inferred as a general feature of echinoderms.

photoreception.notes: The presence and nature of photoreception in Faujasiidae is currently unknown based on the provided information. Some echinoderms possess light-sensitive cells, but this has not been confirmed for this family.
